name: Sheraton Pentagon City Hotel

reviews.text: I was exceptionally pleased with these accommodations. The hotel contained all the essentials with a tasteful style that reflected the military significance of its location. Over our 6 day stay, we saw a total range of guests and events from corporate meetings and youth groups to ethnic celebrations and family reunions. The staff were exceptional in meeting guests' inquiries and requests. On site Manager, Nkuo Cyprian, was so very considerate and efficient in helping us to solve several problems.
reviews.title: The Sheraton National Hotel is a compact class act!

reviews.text: I hotwired for two rooms for hubby and 3 teens for a night at the start of Spring break (cruising out of Baltimore on the Sunday). Got a great deal for $59 a night per room plus taxes. I knew parking would be extra, and we had to pay $20 for a rollaway (Queen bed in the rooms didn't work for the three teens!) but it was a clean, attractive hotel (lobby AND rooms) - worth a lot more in my opinion. No issue with showers or anything else. We had one day to see some of Washington DC the next day so I didn't bother paying for wireless internet and just popped downstairs to the business centre to check emails. We drove into DC quickly and easy the next morning (a Saturday). Incidentally, I emailed the hotel in advance asking for adjoining rooms with a view (7th floor and up on a particular side) and they were able to accommodate. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Great Hotel for a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this place through Hotwire for the July 4th weekend. When checking in i asked the lady if she could put us in a room with a good view of DC. Even though there were no rooms with queen beds available she upgraded us to a room with King bed and higher floor just to accommodate my request. We got a room in the 10 floor with a fabulous view of the Washington Monument. Also the rooms are clean and are of top quality. The hotel has shuttles to Metro and so i didn't even have to hire a care. They even booked the Super shuttle to Dulles airport on request. This was the best ever hotel stay I had in recent times. Very memorable. Will stay there again and wont hesitate to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton National with our 2 daughters ages 9 and 5. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is close to everything you want to see. They have a shuttle that takes you to the subway. The subway is easy to use, cheap and safe. The shuttle also takes you to the airport. They have a pool on the 16th floor that is indoors. The hotel was clean.
reviews.title: They make it easy to enjoy your vacation.

reviews.text: I just had my wedding reception in the Galaxy Room which is located on the top floor, amazing view of D.C. by the way. I must say that the Sheraton National has exceeded my expectations and made my wedding day a memorable one.
reviews.title: Exceeded my Expectations A++!!!

reviews.text: The no 1 complaint comment about this Hotel was daily parking charge of $16. I stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights and did not pay for parking. What's the Secret ? After 6pm metered parking is free, on sunday parking is also free all day. Also at the end of the road on osme street and then a few feet on the right there is on-street parking without any restrictions near the cemetry but you have to be early and be prepared to walk back to hotel. This hotel is in the most safest zone who cares about how neighborhood looks as we we out of the Hotel everyday by 10:00am, Excellent shuttle service and very good room. Why i did not give 5 because it did not offer breakfast. I will stay again
reviews.title: Great Hotel and free parking, location safe

likes.liked: — Location and shuttle service to the Mall and Airport

reviews.text: OK, let's get this out of the way first: Yes, dreadful location. Nasty looking, dilapidated houses across the street begging for a bulldozer. Nothing within walking distance, and even if there was, you wouldn't dare. A friend who works at the Pentagon says they have meetings here, and will walk if it's daylight only. Hotel shuttle or rental cars only. Period. Everyone happy now?
reviews.title: Great staff in a nice hotel in a truly unfortunate location...

likes.liked: — The employees just tried so very, very hard...
likes.disliked: — Dreadful location... can't we just beam this place next to the mall?

reviews.text: Stayed from Sept. 6th to 9th. Very Nice hotel. Room was large and clean. Nice view. The staff was wonderful exept for the Shuttle Bus. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere. There is nothing that you would want to walk to. The shuttle bus was never on time. We always had to call. One day we went to a very nice health club because the hotel pool is under repair. We took the shuttle and when we called for the return we waited almost an hour. When he came he stopped a bolck away and honked his horn. We had to run and catch the van in the middle of the block. The driver did not get out. We had to open the side door and get in in the middle of traffic. When we got back to the hotel I complained and the Staff appoligized. We thought overall everything was nice. The restaurant was good and not too overpriced. The 16 dollars a day parking was very reasonable compaired to other cities we stayed. If you do not use the Shuttle it is a Great Hotel
reviews.title: Graet Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a really good deal through the hotel, so I can't really complain too much! The hotel itself is nice, spacious, and clean. Our room was very nice, although it didn't have a great view-but that was ok. We didn't have any hot water problems-shower and sink were fine.
reviews.title: Overall fine

reviews.text: My only complaint is their shuttle service to the Pentagon City metro stop. They claim they run 15 mins before and after the hour, but two days in a row they only ran once an hour. It was really frustrating since we could have used that time doing other things. The hotel manager was concerned when we told her about it and promised to see to it that it runs more smoothly.
reviews.title: No Hot Shower in One Room, No Hot Water at Sink in the Other

likes.liked: — Very convenient to DCA Airport. Rates were good.
likes.disliked: — The icy cold shower and the high parking charge.

reviews.text: Overall, the actual hotel is great, especially since we got such a good nightly rate and free parking.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Friendliness of staff and cleanliness of room & hotel facilities
likes.disliked: — Steep inclines to walk for bus access

reviews.text: One of my coworkers and I booked two rooms at the Sheraton National on August 26th. We were flying in late to National and needed an easy place to stay before heading off to our clients' site in the morning. The hotel itself was nice in that generic Sheraton business traveler kind of way. The beds were the newer Sheraton Sweet Sleepers, which was great.
reviews.title: GREAT if you have a car

likes.liked: — very nice building/rooms - clean, modern, etc.
likes.disliked: — cost of parking is a little high - $16/night

reviews.text: We requested a room above the 5th floor after getting our hotwire confirmation. We also called the day before as we would be arriving well past check in and Grace the check-In clerk was friendly and accomodating.
reviews.title: Had a great time at Sherton National

likes.liked: — Large room, views, shuttle service to metro, safe neighborhood
likes.disliked: — charges for every little thing, roll away, internet, parking

reviews.text: We were a family of four. Our room was on the 11th floor, was kept clean each day by staff. We took the free shuttle to the DC metro (5 minutes away) severl days and had no problems catching the shuttle both directions. Also where it lets you off is in front of a major mall with a food court and Ruby Tuesdays.
reviews.title: Forget Southern Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are no services (food, stores) near the hotel. So if you don't do a car, you'll have to use the shuttle.
reviews.title: 50% Chance of Nice City View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a good review, but what they could do better at:
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: We wanted a roll-way bed for one kid, however they charge $20 A DAY for a roll-away/cot. Outrageous! The pool was rather small and located on the 16th floor, which was enclosed with glass and the chlorine smell was pretty strong. They charge for Parking, $16/day, check to see if a monthly pass is cheaper. For 7 days the monthly was $12 cheaper.
reviews.title: Okay, try other hotels first

reviews.text: If you are flying into Reagan on business, Sheraton provides a free shuttle and there is a shuttle to the nearby mall Crystal City. I had a rental car and Arlington is a maze even with GPS. The hotel is clean. The towels are small but they do give you lots. The bed is good and so are the pillows. The room was quiet. The room service is excellent. I ate breakfast and dinner, the cesear salad with chicken was really good. The staff is attentive and pleasant. I have stayed here twice and have been pleased.
reviews.title: Location and Room Service

reviews.text: I was here for two nights for a business conference held at the hotel in September 2010. I was in a standard room with two double beds on the 11th floor.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, But No Sound Insulation

reviews.text: The hotel was very nice- room was spacious, clean, had a nice desk and a nice lounge chair. Everything was clean, no problemo. Also, they provide free shuttle service to and from the airport (shuttles come and go every half hour) and free shuttle service to and from the mall, where there's tons of restaurants and shops, and access to a metro station that will take you anywhere in DC. Very convenient.
reviews.title: Tremendously accomodating staff

reviews.text: My only problem with this trip was that there was virtually no sound insulation in the room. I could hear my neighbors talking through the walls, and when they turned on the tv... it was like being back in an apartment, with noisy neighbors and you want to go tell them to shut UP! Except my neighbors weren't doing anything wrong, they just had their tv on. Luckily they turned it off after about an hour or I wouldn't have been able to sleep.
reviews.title: Average Sheraton with virtually no sound insulation and loud A/C.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, very nice trip- might stay there again. Might.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay!

reviews.text: Parking was $20, Internet was $12, no offstreet parking, Front desk could not speak very good English (Asian), pool closes at 9pm. It was decorated very nicely but our view was of the "projects" across the street. We realized that we had left an Ipod Touch in the room and called the hotel..amazingly, it wasn't found. Spend the extra money and stay in a better hotel. Website said Bathrobes and fitness center, you have to stay in the higher priced rooms for that.
reviews.title: Near Arlington Cemetery & MC base but in unsafe area

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sheraton National Hotel with a group for a reunion. The hotel staff were so helpful and gracious! I didn't know hotel personnel were capable of this much customer service any more. Tara Nam at the front desk was able to answer every question and/or help with any issue...and with a soft demeaner and a smile! Oh, and the views from the room was beautiful.
reviews.title: Every Hotel should be like this.

reviews.text: Elly Kang and staffhave been more than gracious and helpful during the entire Korea/COld War family conference. It is a pleasure and relief knowing the staff iis ready to assist in what ever manner needed in support and make the event a complete success.
reviews.title: The staff and hotel were outstanding, makes it a pleaure to travel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: please keep up the great work.
reviews.title: Above average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DeWayne Reed
reviews.title: Excellent Staff

reviews.text: Stayed here with a girlfriend and was amazed at the hotel for the price. I was able to get this as a 3+Ultimate on Travelocity for $99 per night and would have paid at least 2 1/2 times that in DC proper! The shuttles came often and the staff were very helpful and accomodating to any questions we had. When we were staying there there were over 500 kids staying on a variety of field trips for a couple days and the "Second Amendment Rally" to the capital was also that weekend (found this out a couple days before we left!) and many attendees were obviously staying at the hotel as well. Through all this the staff were really wonderful and friendly and the service was amazing. Make sure you make it up to the roof at night even for a peek-the view is spectacular!
reviews.title: Amazing value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked through priceline, so got quite a cheap deal. For the price it was excellent value. The room was a good size and clean and modern. Costly internet in rooms, but all Sheraton's I've stayed at provide a "link" where free wifi and public computers are available. A free shuttle runs between the hotel and the local mall/subway, which makes getting around easy by subway. It was also only about a 20 min walk to the mall once you knew the way.
reviews.title: Good basics, pay for "extras"
Not as expected for a 3+ hotel
reviews.text: The only anoyance was being invited to pay for anything you asked for, either directly or to buy it from the gift shop. Bedsheets giving you a rash? No, we won't consider replacing them, buy antihistemes from the gift shop. Want a fridge in your room? Sure, for "only" $20 per night extra. Lost your credit card and need to ring home reverse charges? Sorry, neither our hotel phones nor the public phones allow such a service, so buy a calling card from the gift shop.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And so on.
reviews.title: really enjoyable and fantastic staff

reviews.text: Overall it was good, but I have stayed in much better Sheratons (Back bay in Boston leaps to mind) and the nickle and diming is an annoyance.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel; Great location!

description: Enjoy familiar comforts and a warm welcome at the Sheraton National Hotel. With the Reagan National Airport, Metro Rail Station, downtown Washington D.C., and the Pentagon all just minutes away.
